alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 1:48PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Montana Creek near areas around the low water crossing on Montana Creek Road. * WHEN...Until midnight AKDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 146 PM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding of small streams, especially near Montana Creek. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rates of 0.1-0.2 inches per 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - For Montana Creek at Back Loop Bridge: At 1:00pm the stage was 13.43 feet. Flood Stage is 14.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 14.79 feet is expected around 8:00pm Saturday. Impacts: At 14.5 feet: Water begins flowing over the low water crossing on Montana Creek Road. Bankfull conditions at the gauge with water starting to inundate adjacent undeveloped fields along Mendenhall Loop Road. - If you live near or along Montana Creek stay alert and be prepared to take action. - The ongoing rains could swamp boats. Mariners should check their vessels immediately.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
